# Call for Tender
## Reference Number: cb-923-41916925
## Solicitation Number: 24-58024

### Project Overview
The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is seeking a contractor to install a Level 3 Electric Vehicle (EV) Charger outside Building U-87 located at the Lester Road Campus of the NRC.

### Tender Requirements
Tenders must be submitted electronically to NRC.BidReceiving-ReceptiondesSoumissions.CNRC@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca before June 4th, 2024, 2:00 PM EST.

### Mandatory Site Visit
A mandatory site visit will be held on May 9th or 10th, 2024, at 9:30 AM. It is mandatory for bidders to attend one of the site visits. The site visit will be held at Building U-89, 2320 Lester Road, Ottawa, ON.

### Evaluation Criteria
Tenders will be evaluated on a combination of technical score and price rating. The evaluation criteria include:

* Technical merit (40%): Including experience, qualifications, and overall experience of proposed Construction Site Supervisor and Project Manager.
* Price rating (60%): Including tendered amount.

### Mandatory Requirements
The following mandatory requirements must be met:

* The Proponent must have a minimum of ten (10) years' experience as a general contractor providing construction services comparable to this tender.
* The Proponent must provide a CV for the proposed Construction Site Supervisor and Project Manager.
* The Proponent must demonstrate membership in any recognized general contractor association in Ontario.

### Security Requirement
The contractor must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

### Tender Documents
Tender documents can be obtained through the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider.

### Contact Information
For any inquiries regarding the project, please contact:

* Nick Becker, Departmental Representative (or his designate)
* Collin Long, Contracting Authority

## Evaluation Process
The evaluation committee will review and rate the technical components of the tenders based on the evaluation criteria. The successful bidder will be the one who accumulates the highest combined score of the technical assessment and tendered amount.
